ratings.comment: Gregorio was one of the best Calculus Professors I had at my time here at UW. His exams were very fair, his lectures were straightforward, and he was funny.  I recommend doing all the homework even though it may not be collected and study for the quizzes. Possible to get an A and may make your 222 experience enjoyable as opposed to others.

Aloof, dry sense of humor, and overall a good professor to take for upper level classes. Writes his own problems that you must be creative on! 521 is overall a tough class but you'll make it if you know the definitions by heart.
He's funny, helpful, and have nice handwriting. Easy to follow, not like many math profs. Definitely going to his class for complete notes, will help you for exams, A LOT. Fair grading as well.

Moreno is a decent professor. There's no homework which is good and bad. Good because I didn't open the book once all semester. Bad because the disc. quizzes worth 20% of my grade show that. However, the midterms weren't bad...they were basically the exact same problems as the ones on his practice exams. He has a sweet spanish accent too. Cool guy.
His examples given in class are hard to follow. Lectures are boring. Definitely need to use other resources (office hours, tutor) to do well in this class. Exams are hard but fair

Professor Moreno can be a good teacher, it depends on the subject. All the problems he suggests are optional, it's really up to you how well you do in the course. The exam was extremely difficult, and having problems similar to it would have helped.

Wow.. His exams are extremely difficult. I have heard him say multiple times "I dont have anything smart to say about that" to theorems he writes, and equations, etc. So hard to understand. My class average for the first midterm was a 51%. He's very difficult.
Such a nice professor. He helped me a lot before the final and his grading was very fair.

Alright professor. The examples he does in class are good but exams are difficult and don't follow the material covered. Office hours help a lot, so definitely go if you can!! Nice guy but hard as a professor :/

Not a fan of him at all. Very hard to understand since he is so quiet. Not helpful during office hours since he only takes one person at a time. Tests are very unpredictable. Very difficult. Not for the weary.

He is an average instructor. Clear about his material, but sticks to whatever is on the textbook. I like him because his handwriting is very clear, and he is helpful when answering questions. I do not like him because he cannot explain complex theorems very well, and his exams are not predictable. Besides, he rarely arrives in class on time -__-.

He is helpful and nice and always willing to explain until you understand. Very approachable. However, his class was very difficult, and what will appear on the exam is unpredictable. In this class, you will deal with a lot of theories behind probability, and he's not very clear when explaining the concepts.

Worst professor I've had here. Incomprehensible lectures read directly from textbook. Exams not extremely hard but he did things like including slight variants of extremely difficult problems he did in lecture, where if you did not see the resemblance you were in trouble. Exams were thus too easy or way too hard.
without a doubt, the best math professor i've had here.  helpful, clear, and straightforward.  he even has a sense of humor!  take one of his classes, if possible.
writing is very clear on the board. he is extremely kind and helpful in the office hour and after class.
great teacher! difficult to understand at times, but tests are easy as long as you go to the review sessions that are held.

An awesome professor! Take him for calc 221 if you can- much easier than the other professors! He's hilarious and goes through the material slowly so you have quite a bit of time to pick up on it. I LOVE G!
He's a great guy, funny, always makes jokes during lecture. I wish I could have him again! Gregorio is fo' shorio!
